knowledge_graph.title: Bengaluru
knowledge_graph.description: Bengaluru (also called Bangalore) is the capital of India's southern Karnataka state. The center of India's high-tech industry, the city is also known for its parks and nightlife. By Cubbon Park, Vidhana Soudha is a Neo-Dravidian legislative building. Former royal residences include 19th-century Bangalore Palace, modeled after England’s Windsor Castle, and Tipu Sultan’s Summer Palace, an 18th-century teak structure. ― Google

related_questions.question: Is Bangalore worth visiting?
related_questions.snippet: Known as the garden city, Bengaluru has many patches of greenery throughout the city. The city has many parks, the most famous ones being Cubbon Park and Lalbagh Botanical Garden. In fact, the name Garden city was given because of Hyder Ali's planned garden Lalbagh.
related_questions.title: 5 Reasons to Visit Bengaluru/Bangalore (2024)

related_questions.question: How many days to visit Bangalore?
related_questions.snippet: You need at least 3 to 4 days to explore and see most of the sight seeing places in Bangalore. There are many things to do in the city and it caters for all kinds of travelers. From ancient and historical temples to the party lovers, this city has it all.
related_questions.title: Exploring City Highlights: 3 Days Trip in Bangalore (2024)

related_questions.question: What is Bangalore famous for?
related_questions.snippet: Bangalore is sometimes referred to as the “Silicon Valley of India” (or “IT capital of India”) because of its role as the nation's leading information technology (IT) exporter. Indian technological organisations ISRO, Infosys, Wipro and HAL are headquartered in the city.
